newsitem.title: UK: Brown announces audit of UK Treasury forecasts.
newsitem.headline: Brown announces audit of UK Treasury forecasts.

text.p: Chancellor of the Exchequer Gordon Brown announced on Tuesday an independent audit of the Treasury's forecasts.
"There must be honest finances as well as sound finances," Brown said on BBC radio 4.
The National audit office would look at the assumptions behind the official forecasts, he said.
"I think people right across the country will welcome the fact that the books are being opened to an independent body which will look at these matters and report on them," Brown said.
Asked if he had an utter commitment to transparent Treasury forecasts, Brown replied "of course."
He also pledged to publish a Green Paper six months before every budget "so that people have a chance to have a real debate about the budget.
"There will be openness as well as soundness in the public finances," he said.

Brown said he was determined that decisions would be taken for the long term. "People are fed up with the stop/go, with the boom/bust. They want a long-term footing for both the National finances and the National economic policy.
He said that Britian was 21st on the OECD's league table and that this was not good enough. "We have got to do better," he said.

Brown also said that he would not renege on his manifesto commitments, in the budget expected within a few weeks. "We have only made promises that we can keep and the promises we have made we will keep and I am determined on that," he said.
